Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; two added white bands above row of three lotus buds in white outline with added red centres; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: A label with A 916 (1) written in pencil is glued to the exterior surface of the sherd. Cook and Woodhead show British Museum 1924,1201.846, 1924,1201.728 and 1924,1201.584 together as if joined. The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.584 and 1924,1201.846.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 167, no. 89, pl. 34, no. 15)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 722, no. 811)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (pl. XXI, no. 742) (one of the sherds)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1954) (phase 2)
